title: How to Manage Who Can Send You Friend Requests on Facebook

steps.title: Open Facebook.
steps.content: Open Facebook. It's a dark-blue app with a white "f" on it. Doing so will open your News Feed if you're logged into Facebook. If you aren't logged in, go ahead and log in with your email address (or phone number) and password.

steps.title: Tap ☰ or your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap ☰ or your profile icon. It's either in the bottom-right corner of the screen (iPhone) or in the top-right corner of the screen (Android).

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Settings & privacy . It's next to an icon that resembles a gear. It's towards the bottom of your profile menu. This expands the Settings & privacy menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Settings.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Settings . It's at the top of the "Settings & privacy" menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap How people find and contact you.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap How people find and contact you . It's below "Audience and visibility" header.

steps.title: Select Friends of Friends.
steps.content: Select Friends of Friends . You can do so using the drop-down menu next to "Who can send you friend requests?" You can't stop all friend requests, but you can make it so that only friends of friends can send you a friend request.

steps.title: Toggle off "Do you want search engines outside of Facebook to link to your profile."
steps.content: Toggle off "Do you want search engines outside of Facebook to link to your profile." It's towards the bottom of the menu. This prevents people from finding your Facebook profile using search engines like Google.

steps.title: Toggle off "Allow your profile to be recommended to people looking at similar profiles."
steps.content: Toggle off "Allow your profile to be recommended to people looking at similar profiles." It's at the very bottom of the menu. This prevents your Facebook profile from being sent to other people looking for similar profiles. [1] X Research source For additional privacy, make sure "People with your email address" and "People with your phone number" are set to "No one." Set "Who can see your friends list" to "Only me". Then go through the rest of the privacy settings to make sure your Facebook page is private .

steps.title: Go to Facebook's website.
steps.content: Go to Facebook's website. It's at https://www.facebook.com/ . If you're already logged into Facebook, doing so will open your News Feed. If you aren't logged into Facebook, go ahead and log in with your email address (or phone number) and password in the upper-right side of the page.

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture. It's in the upper-right corner of the Facebook page.

steps.title: Click Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Click Settings & privacy . It's in the pop-up menu that appears when you click your profile icon. It's next to an icon that resembles a gear.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's at the top of the "Privacy & settings" in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Scroll down and click How people find and contact you.
steps.content: Scroll down and click How people find and contact you . It's below "Audience and visibility" header in the menu bar to the left.
